intro: Myoxanthus oliviae, commonly known as the Olivia's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and dense, bushy growth habit. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species in its native habitat.
